SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.http

Class Response

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.http.Response
public final class Response extends Object
Represents an HTTP response received from a request made via RequestBuilder. Provides methods to access response status, headers, body as text, JSON, or binary data.

This class encapsulates an HttpResponse and an ObjectMapper for JSON deserialization.

Usage Example: 


 Response response = Http.get("https://api.example.com/data").execute();
 if (response.isSuccessful()) {
     String content = response.text();
     System.out.println("Response: " + content);
 }
Since:
1.0
Author:
William Beaudin

    • Response

      public Response(HttpResponse<byte[]> httpResponse, com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper mapper)
      Constructs a Response object wrapping an HTTP response.
      Parameters:
      httpResponse - The original HTTP response.
      mapper - The JSON ObjectMapper used for deserialization.

  • Method Details

    • status

      public int status()
      Retrieves the HTTP status code of the response.
      Returns:
      The HTTP status code.

    • header

      public String header(String name)
      Retrieves a specific header value from the response.
      Parameters:
      name - The header name.
      Returns:
      The header value, or an empty string if not found.

    • headers

      public Map<String,String> headers()
      Retrieves all response headers as a map.
      Returns:
      A map of header names to their first associated value.

    • text

      public String text()
      Retrieves the response body as a UTF-8 encoded string.
      Returns:
      The response body as a string.

    • bytes

      public byte[] bytes()
      Retrieves the raw response body as a byte array.
      Returns:
      The response body in binary form.

    • json

      public <T> T json(Class<T> clazz) throws IOException
      Parses the response body as a JSON object of the specified class type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of object to deserialize into.
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class type to map the JSON response to.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object.
      Throws:
      IOException - If deserialization fails.

    • json

      public <T> T json(com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> typeReference) throws IOException
      Parses the response body as a JSON object using a TypeReference, allowing for deserialization into generic types.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of object to deserialize into.
      Parameters:
      typeReference - The TypeReference specifying the target type.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object.
      Throws:
      IOException - If deserialization fails.

    • file

      public JoltFile file()
      Converts the response body into a JoltFile, using the content type and filename from the response headers when available.
      Returns:
      A JoltFile representing the response content.

    • isSuccessful

      public boolean isSuccessful()
      Determines whether the response indicates a successful request (status 200-299).
      Returns:
      true if the response has a successful status code, otherwise false.
